section.p: NPAM enables you to administer and view information about the nodes in your network. Use the Add Network Objects panel to select the nodes you want to perform an administration job on or the nodes you want to retrieve information from.

To launch the Add Network Objects panel, select the Add Topology Data button. The Add Topology Data button is available in the Job Details and Node Selection step of the NPAM wizards and from the Network panel which is available from the action bar in the different NPAM applications.
The Add Network Objects panel menu provides the following tabs:

ul.li: Topology tab – use this to select individual nodes from a logical view of your network
Search tab – use this to select nodes from the list of nodes generated when you Enter Search Criteria
Collections tab – use this to select a collection, or collections, of nodes
Saved Searches tab – use this to select a saved search

section.p: Use the relevant tab to specify the required network objects and select Add. This returns you to the Job Details and Node Selection step of the NPAM wizard, or, to the Network panel in the relevant NPAM application page.
Note: In the Search tab if you select Managed Objects (MOs) that NPAM does not support and select Add, the node is automatically discarded by Job, as reported in this note:
When creating a NPAM job using the wizard the following behaviour applies:

ul.li: If the nodes are added as individual network objects (using the Search or Topology tabs), the individual nodes can be removed using the Remove Selected button, which is available in the wizard action when node(s) are selected.

If the nodes are added as a collection or the saved search, there is no option to remove individual network objects. Use the Network Explorer application for modifications (add/remove) on a collection or saved search. The entire collection or saved search can be removed using the delete icon
